value.description: Preview Release; I18N, Acl, Auth, Session

value.name: Zend_Measure
value.description: Zend_Measure is a locale aware Class which can convert measurement units.

value.body:
*) You can not affect a version which is not public...
*) Please check with the latest branch:
http://framework.zend.com/svn/framework/branch/i18n-pre0.8

a) What weirdness is it to have intentionally non-working code in HEAD? However, the tests do not run at all from branch:

sh-3.1$ phpunit -d include_path=.:library/:tests/:/opt/php/lib/php LocaleTest tests/Zend/LocaleTest.php

Warning: require_once(Zend.php): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in /home/sebastian/Work/i18n-pre0.8/tests/Zend/LocaleTest.php on line 30

Fatal error: require_once(): Failed opening required 'Zend.php' (include_path='.:library/:tests/:/opt/php/lib/php') in /home/sebastian/Work/i18n-pre0.8/tests/Zend/LocaleTest.php on line 30

Do I need to merge the branch into HEAD? This is weird!

b) 0.7.0 is released and the code is not contained in 0.7.0. So it affects everything but not ZF <= 0.7.0. Instead it is in HEAD which I suppose is going to be 0.8.0 sooner or later, so it affects 0.8.0 in my eyes.

The code was intended to work...
But the release 0.7 was very complicated as we has to rework the API several times. We were told to include even not finished code so we can release.

This was the reason why we made a new branch, so we can rework the complete API as wished by Zend without touching existing work or braking the core.

The branch itself should ge back to core in 2-4 days.

Merging the branch back to core means just to copy the branch over the core files, not more.

Running the branch tests mean to go to the directory tests within the branch and then:
phpunit -d max_execution_time=0 Zend_LocaleTest

I suppose it's easier for you to wait until the end of this week until we have recored the new API.

Btw: Related to affected version... you should have used "unknown Version" instead of 0.8 as 0.8 is not released until now.

Please test this issue with SVN 3233.

On problems please give us information on your system, phpversion and systems standard language and location.

One of them is still failing:
1) testNumberSetType(Zend_Measure_NumberTest)
Zend_Locale_Math_Exception: modulo overflow: 1.2351641146031E-322 % 2 (result=5.928787750095E-323)

/home/sebastian/Work/ZendFramework/library/Zend/Measure/Number.php:344
/home/sebastian/Work/ZendFramework/tests/Zend/Measure/NumberTest.php:158
